alert.note: Alert for McKinley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 1:53PM MDT until August 26 at 8:24PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central New Mexico, including the following county, McKinley. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 151 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms near Yah-Ta-hey. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.75 and 1 inch of rain has fallen in the last 30 minutes. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Yah-Ta-Hey, Rock Springs and Twin Lakes. - Expect ponding water and minor flooding on Highway 491.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
